page.title: 04FARMING
page.content: The area between Clothall and Baldock is mainly arable land. The soil profiles are principally rendzinas, but to the S.E. of Clothall there are brown earths, developed on chalky boulder clays with flints. The land is owned by large farms situated in Weston and along the A507 and is classified as Grades 1 and 2. The principle crops are wheat, barley, and oilseed rape, with some fields of broad beans adjacent to Clothall. The few grazing fields are small, spread out, and located on land which is too difficult to cultivate. The arable fields are large with few hedges, woods, or copses. The cattle are mainly beef breed Charolais Hereford cross.
